'''''Lactarius rubrilacteus''''' is a species of [[mushroom]] of the [[genus]] ''Lactarius''.<ref name="rich">{{Cite web|url=http://www.rrich.com/mslactrubri.html|title=''Lactarius rubrilacteus''|accessdate=18 April 2007|author=Robert Rich}}</ref> It is also known as the '''bleeding milkcap''', as is at least one other member of the genus, ''[[Lactarius deliciosus]]''.<ref name="rich" />

==Description==
The [[mushroom]] can be either a bluish green or an orangy brown hue, with creamy white or yellow [[spore]]s that are [[ellipse|ellipsoid]] in shape.<ref name="rog">{{Cite web|url=http://www.rogersmushrooms.com/gallery/DisplayBlock~bid~6333~gid~.asp|publisher=RogersMushrooms.com|title=''Lactarius rubrilacteus''|accessdate=18 April 2007}}</ref><ref name="sci">{{Cite web|url=http://www.pfc.forestry.ca/biodiversity/bcern/description/description-cde15_e.html|accessdate=18 April 2007|title=''Lactarius rubrilacteus'' Hesler & Smith |publisher=British Columbia Ectomycorrhizal Research Network}}</ref> The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] of the mushroom is [[wikt:convex|convex]] and sometimes shield-shaped and {{convert|6|–|12|cm|in|abbr=on}} across, reaching a height of {{convert|5|–|15|cm|in|abbr=on}} tall. The cap also has quite an underfolded margin and a depressive disk.<ref name="rog" />

''Lactarius rubrilacteus'' has many [[laticifer]]s which appear as a white network across the surface of the mushroom.<ref name="sci" /> When sliced or cut, the mushroom flesh will typically release a dark red to purple [[latex]] or [[milk]]y substance.<ref name="rich" /> The [[trama (mycology)|flesh]] itself will lose colour when damaged, and is usually [[granular]] or [[brittle]] to the touch.<ref name="rog" /> The [[stipe (mycology)|stem]] is quite thin, being only several centimetres in any dimension, and is of an average size and shape for a mushroom. The fungus itself exudes a slight [[odor|odour]] that is faintly aromatic.<ref name="rog" /> While it is not known if the mushroom would be [[edible mushroom|edible]], small taste tests reveal that the mushroom is mild to slightly bitter.<ref name="rog" />

==Distribution and habitat==
The mushroom is primarily found in parts of western [[North America]], growing in [[forest]]s and on the ground. The mushroom usually finds cover under [[conifer]] trees, mainly pines.<ref name="rog" /> It is widely distributed in these areas between the months of June and October.<ref name="rog" />

==Chemical reactivity==
*'''[[Potassium hydroxide]]:''' When the mushroom comes in contact with potassium hydroxide, the most of the mushroom, including the mantle and [[ectomycorrhizae]], loses its bluish hue and becomes a dull brown.<ref name="sci" />
*'''[[Melzer's Reagent]]:''' Hardly any visible reaction on any part of the mushroom occurs. This particular mushroom appears to have little reactivity to Melzer's Reagent.<ref name="sci" />
*'''[[Sulfovanillin]]:''' Most of the mushroom becomes a reddish-brown color, but the oldest [[root]]s of the fungi stay unaltered by contact with sulfovanillin.<ref name="sci" />
